Editor Objects¶

There are thre

class editor.FileEditor(fn)[source]¶

This object wraps around the standard Python file object to add further functionality specific for reading and writing to STRAHL parameter files.

To Do:
Figure out back up files? No verbose output at the moment
__init__(fn)[source]¶

Initializes the FileEditor object.

Parameters:file (str) -- The name of the file to be opened.
fn¶

str

_deletions¶

int -- The current number of deletions performed for use in backup file.

_line¶

int -- The current line number.

open_file(read_write_attribute='r+', buffer_time=1)[source]¶

Opens the given file and creates a file standard Python file object.

Parameters:
  • read_write_attribute (str) -- Sets the read and write abilities of the file object.
  • buffer_time (int) -- Sets the buffer time.
file¶

file -- A file object

read_char(n=1)[source]¶

Returns n characters read from the buffer and keeps track of the current line.

Parameters:n [int|1] (*) -- number of characters to be read
Raises:OSError -- If the file object is not readable
Note: This should be used to capture select words from a
setence, rather than read line or lines. For that use FileEditor.readline().
read_lines(n=1)[source]¶

Returns the line read from the buffer and keeps track of the current line.

Parameters:n [int|1] (*) -- The number of lines to read
Raises:OSError -- If the file object is not readable.
cur_loc()[source]¶

Returns the current location in the form of the current character and the current line.

Raises:OSError -- If the file object is not seekable
move(loc=(0, 0))[source]¶

Resets the buffer to the specified location relative to the begining of the buffer and resets the line attribute to the line at the reset location.

Parameters:loc [tuple of int| (*) -- the location to move to
Raises:OSError -- If the file object is not seekable
peak(n=1)[source]¶

Reads n characters read from the buffer, but returns to the initial location.

Parameters:n [int|1] (*) -- the number of characters to read
Returns:The characters read from the file.
Return type:chars
peak_lines(n=1)[source]¶

Reads until a newline is found or EOF, but returns to the initial location.

Parameters:n [int|1] (*) -- the number of lines to read
Returns:The lines read from the file.
Return type:line
update()[source]¶

Updates the buffer immediately

add(addition)[source]¶

Adds the given addition to the file at the current location.

Parameters:addition [str] (*) -- The addition to be added to the file.
Raises:OSError -- If the file is not writable.
delete(deletion='', replacement='', line=0, repeat=1)[source]¶

Deletes the given deletion phrase or by default a single line. The previous file is always saved into a folder called ./_backup.

Paramaters:
  • deletion [str|""]: The string to be deleted.
  • replacement [str|""]: The string to be replaced
  • line [int|0]: The number of lines to be deleted
  • repeat [int|1]: The numbe of repeations
close_file(clean=True)[source]¶

Closes the file and by default deletes the backups for this file in the folder ./_backup
